channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Happens When You Leave the C-Suite? This Startup Has an Answer
item.description: The Interval, a peer community for C-suite executives and founders navigating career transition, launches today. Here’s what they’re offering.

item.title: One of the most generous welfare states in the world is no match for the ‘motherhood penalty’
item.description: Subsidized child care is available for all children from 6 months old in Denmark, and parents pay no more than 25.%. Pay for women still goes down.

item.title: Famed startup incubator Y Combinator to let founders receive funds in stablecoins
item.description: The move is significant since, in the past, generally just crypto VC firms have let startups receive funding in the form of digital assets.

item.title: Wall Street Is Buying the ‘White House Put’ on Rare Earths
item.description: President Trump unveiled Project Vault to de-risk from China.

item.title: Kairos, which is building a cross-platform tool for prediction markets traders, raises $2.5 million from a16z crypto
item.description: The startup’s platform will display bets from Kalshi and Polymarket.

item.title: How Your Company Can Reduce the Unequal Strains on Women Working From Home
item.description: Remote work is entrenched in our culture, and it’s time to address some of the practices downsides for family life.

item.title: Oracle billionaire Larry Ellison’s next big bet: Redefining how long–and how well–we live
item.description: As people live longer and birth rates fall, longevity is becoming a major challenge–and opportunity–for business and society alike.
